channel.title: Google Cloud on Vitthal Mirji
channel.description: Recent content in Google Cloud on Vitthal Mirji

item.title: GenAI with Google Cloud plus Prompt Engineering
item.description: 📎 Focus: Hands-on workflows using GCP’s AI tools + Open Source LLMs

item.title: GenAI with Google Cloud + Prompt Engineering
item.description:
🚀 Introduction

Welcome to the world of GenAI on Google Cloud, where prompts become pipelines and imagination drives innovation. In this post, we’ll explore how to design, iterate, and deploy GenAI pipelines using Vertex AI, smart prompt engineering, and scalable GCP services. Strap in—this is going to get technical, creative, and fun.

🎯 1. What is Prompt Engineering?

Prompt engineering is the art and science of crafting inputs to LLMs to elicit desired outputs. It’s like programming with words. 🚀

item.title: A Data Engineering Perspective on Go vs. Python (Part 2 - Dataflow)
item.description:
Introduction

In Part 2 of our comparison of Python and go from a Data Engineering perspective, we’ll finally take a look at Apache Beam and Google Dataflow and how the go SDK and the Python SDK differ, what drawbacks we’re dealing with, how fast it is by running extensive benchmarks,and how feasible it is to make the switch.

You can find Part 1 here

Apache Beam & Google Dataflow

While we have used Apache Beam on several occasions before , allow me to give another short introduction.

item.title: A look at Apache Hadoop in 2019
item.description:
Introduction

In this article, we’ll take a look at whether Apache Hadoop still a viable option in 2019, with Cloud driven data processing an analytics on the rise.

When I first started using the Apache Hadoop Ecosystem, things around the magic buzzwords of “Big Data” and “Machine Learning” were quite different compared to what happened since. In this article, we will take a look at what happened since and how it compares against powerful, managed Cloud providers in 2019.
